abstract: Edwina Sandys sculpture Christa, depicting crucified woman, is returning to Cathedral of St John the Divine in Manhattan, more than three decades after it was removed from church by Episcopal Diocese of New York amid accusations of blasphemy; 250-pound bronze statue is centerpiece of exhibit The Christa Project: Manifesting Divine Bodies, featuring works that reinterpret image of Jesus.
lead_paragraph: When a female Christ figure was shown at the Cathedral Church of St. John the Divine in 1984, a church official ordered its removal. Now it has returned as the centerpiece of a new exhibit.

headline.main: An ‘Evolving’ Episcopal Church Invites Back a Controversial Sculpture
headline.print_headline: Once Ordered Removed, Statue Is Now Embraced by Church
